page.title: 04Bridge Farm
page.content:
Bridge Farm is run by the tenant farmer and his son. Although they have a landrover and tractors to help them at very busy times they may have to work as much as 15 hrs. a day.
They keep 50 dairy cows which produce milk for sale and a flock of 300 sheep. The animals graze on 180 acres of the land and 70 acres are used for growing crops of hay,silage, rape and winter and spring barley.
The same family has kept this farm for many years. The present tenant and his son have to work very hard but they would not like to change their lives in any way. They deplore the fact that younger village families cannot afford to live here and have to seek employment further afield.
